abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Expenditure Support Credit
            Project seeks to a) help safeguard Albania's
            functioning public institutions during the impact of the
            conflict in Kosovo; b) maintain macroeconomic stabilization,
            while reducing possibilities for revenue collection; c) help
            monitor and enforce an orderly public expenditure pattern
            during a period of emergency; and d) establish a vehicle for
            cofinancing and parallel financing for other donors. The
            benefits of this project will 1) restore and maintain
            macroeconomic stability and help to ensure availability of
            non-inflationary financing for the extraordinary
            expenditures necessitated by the crisis; 2) provide
            budgetary support to allow the government to release those
            expenditures which were frozen; and 3) protect budgetary
            expenditures essential to achieve Albania's long term
            development objectives. The main risk is that hostilities
            will continue with inflow of refugees into Albania. This can
            only be addressed through future follow-up interventions
            supported by the international donor community. Additional
            risks are the possibility of a deterioration in economic
            governance and the potential loss of macroeconomic
            stability. This risk will be mitigated by strengthening
            public expenditure management and providing critical budget support.
